[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Memory Safety in Checker Cloning] Does the clone operation on CheckerConfig before calling try_into_boxed_checker() properly handle checkers with large embedded data, or could excessive cloning cause memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Missing Path Sanitization] Does the function sanitize or normalize the PathBuf input before use, or can attackers exploit path canonicalization bugs (e.g., '/./././file.yaml') to bypass security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Relative Path Exploitation] Can attackers provide relative paths that resolve differently depending on current working directory, potentially accessing unintended configuration files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [URL Scheme Validation] If node_address fields in the configuration contain URLs, are dangerous schemes (file://, ftp://, etc.) rejected, or only safe HTTP/HTTPS schemes allowed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Port Number Validation] Are port numbers in node_address fields (api_port, metrics_port, noise_port) validated to be in valid ranges (1-65535) and not using privileged ports without authorization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Async Cancellation Safety] If the async validate() function is cancelled or times out mid-execution, are file handles properly closed and resources cleaned up, or could this lead to resource leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Concurrent File Access] If multiple concurrent calls to validate() access the same configuration file, could race conditions in file reading lead to corrupted or partial configuration data being validated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Configuration Name XSS] Is the configuration_name field sanitized for HTML/JavaScript injection, or could malicious names like '<script>alert(1)</script>' exploit the NHC frontend when displaying configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Command Injection via Runner Config] Are runner_config fields validated to prevent command injection if the runner spawns subprocesses or executes system commands based on configuration values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [SQL Injection in Storage] If configuration data is stored in a database, are configuration_id and configuration_name properly escaped to prevent SQL injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Serde Deny Unknown Fields Bypass] While BaselineConfiguration uses #[serde(deny_unknown_fields)], can attackers exploit nested structures without this attribute to inject unexpected fields that bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Integer Overflow in Config Values] Are integer fields in runner_config or provider_configs validated for reasonable ranges, or could maximum u64 values cause integer overflow in duration calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Negative Duration Values] Can cache_ttl_ms or check_delay_secs be set to extreme values that cause Duration::from_* to panic or wrap around, leading to unexpected timing behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Public Key Validation] Is the optional public_key field in NodeAddress validated for correct format and length, or can malformed keys pass validation and cause runtime errors in HandshakeChecker? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Key Material in Debug Logs] Does the debug! statement at line 20 that logs the full configuration potentially expose cryptographic public keys or other sensitive material that should remain confidential? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Provider Config Validation Gap] Does the function validate provider_configs fields, or can attackers inject malicious API endpoints, metrics URLs, or noise protocol parameters that bypass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Cache TTL Manipulation] Can extremely low or high cache_ttl_ms values in provider configs cause denial of service through excessive API requests or stale data attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-labs/aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Check Delay Exploitation] Can malicious check_delay_secs values of 0 or extreme values disrupt checker timing assumptions, causing race conditions or resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Context String Injection] Can the error context message 'Configuration failed validation' be manipulated through error chains to inject misleading messages or hide the true error cause? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Build Checkers Error Context] Does the error context 'Failed to build Checkers' provide sufficient detail for debugging without exposing sensitive internal information to potential attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Mixed Format Attack] Can an attacker provide a file with mismatched extension and content (e.g., .yaml extension but JSON content) to exploit format detection logic or trigger unexpected parser behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [Binary File Injection] If an attacker provides a binary file instead of YAML/JSON, will deserialization fail gracefully, or could it trigger undefined behavior or crashes in the parser? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate()] [BOM Handling] Can UTF-8 Byte Order Marks or other encoding markers in configuration files cause parsing inconsistencies or bypass validation checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Checker Dependency Validation] If certain checkers require specific provider configs to be present, does validation enforce these dependencies, or can invalid checker/provider combinations pass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/validate.rs] [Function: validate_configuration()] [Baseline Node Requirement] For checkers requiring a baseline node, does validation ensure node_address is present and valid, or can checkers fail at runtime due to missing baseline configuration? (Medium)
